9702/22  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 300, 390, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 AS Level Structured Questions  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[780, 300, 905, 316]]<|/det|>
May/June 2025  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[752, 325, 905, 341]]<|/det|>
1 hour 15 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 395, 371]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 359, 400]]<|/det|>
No additional materials are needed.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 222, 433]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 808, 558]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You may use a calculator.- You should show all your working and use appropriate units.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 588, 213, 602]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 604, 730, 635]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 60.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 74, 128, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>Data</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 104, 593, 121]]<|/det|>
acceleration of free fall \(g = 9.81 \text{ m s}^{-2}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 136, 640, 153]]<|/det|>
speed of light in free space \(c = 3.00 \times 10^{8} \text{ m s}^{-1}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 168, 630, 185]]<|/det|>
elementary charge \(e = 1.60 \times 10^{-19} \text{ C}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 200, 630, 217]]<|/det|>
unified atomic mass unit \(1 \text{ u} = 1.66 \times 10^{-27} \text{ kg}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 231, 630, 248]]<|/det|>
rest mass of proton \(m_{\mathrm{p}} = 1.67 \times 10^{-27} \text{ kg}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 262, 630, 279]]<|/det|>
rest mass of electron \(m_{\mathrm{e}} = 9.11 \times 10^{-31} \text{ kg}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 293, 650, 310]]<|/det|>
Avogadro constant \(N_{\mathrm{A}} = 6.02 \times 10^{23} \text{ mol}^{-1}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 324, 630, 341]]<|/det|>
molar gas constant \(R = 8.31 \text{ J K}^{-1} \text{ mol}^{-1}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 355, 650, 371]]<|/det|>
Boltzmann constant \(k = 1.38 \times 10^{-23} \text{ J K}^{-1}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 386, 690, 403]]<|/det|>
gravitational constant \(G = 6.67 \times 10^{-11} \text{ N m}^{2} \text{ kg}^{-2}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 416, 655, 433]]<|/det|>
permittivity of free space \(\epsilon_0 = 8.85 \times 10^{-12} \text{ F m}^{-1}\)

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[405, 435, 650, 465]]<|/det|>
\[( \frac{1}{4 \pi \epsilon_0} = 8.99 \times 10^9 \text{ m F}^{-1} )\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 479, 635, 496]]<|/det|>
Planck constant \(h = 6.63 \times 10^{-34} \text{ J s}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 510, 688, 527]]<|/det|>
Stefan–Boltzmann constant \(\sigma = 5.67 \times 10^{-8} \text{ W m}^{-2} \text{ K}^{-4}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 567, 170, 583]]<|/det|>
<form>Formulae</form>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 600, 560, 616]]<|/det|>
uniformly accelerated motion \(s = ut + \frac{1}{2} at^2\)

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[437, 617, 583, 636]]<|/det|>
\[\nu^2 = u^2 + 2as\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 650, 551, 667]]<|/det|>
hydrostatic pressure \(\Delta p = \rho g \Delta h\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 682, 544, 698]]<|/det|>
upthrust \(F = \rho g V\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 714, 560, 746]]<|/det|>
Doppler effect for sound waves \(f_0 = \frac{f_s V}{V \pm V_s}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 761, 554, 778]]<|/det|>
electric current \(I = \text{Anvq}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 793, 610, 810]]<|/det|>
resistors in series \(R = R_1 + R_2 + \ldots\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 824, 615, 856]]<|/det|>
resistors in parallel \(\frac{1}{R} = \frac{1}{R_1} + \frac{1}{R_2} + \ldots\)

At time \(t = 0\), the car is at rest. At time \(t = 5.8\mathrm{s}\), its velocity is \(17\mathrm{m}\mathrm{s}^{- 1}\). <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 685, 643, 703]]<|/det|> Calculate the kinetic energy of the car at time \(t = 5.8\mathrm{s}\). <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[448, 810, 920, 828]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 628, 920, 678]]<|/det|>

<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 71, 920, 121]]<|/det|>
A small ball is dropped from rest from height \(h_1\) above the ground and falls vertically downwards. The ball collides with the ground and bounces back vertically upwards, reaching a maximum height \(h_2\). Fig. 4.1 shows the ball just before and just after hitting the ground.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[222, 133, 771, 280]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 297, 532, 316]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 4.1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 329, 766, 348]]<|/det|>
The ball has mass \(0.25\mathrm{kg}\) and is in contact with the ground for a time of \(0.18\mathrm{s}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 344, 920, 377]]<|/det|>
Just before the ball hits the ground, it has speed \(5.2\mathrm{m}\mathrm{s}^{- 1}\). Just after it leaves the ground, it has speed \(3.6\mathrm{m}\mathrm{s}^{- 1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 375, 485, 393]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 163, 920, 214]]<|/det|>

The variable resistor in **(b)** is fitted with a scale so that its resistance can be accurately determined.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 101, 920, 135]]<|/det|>
The resistor of resistance \(240 \Omega\) is now replaced by a new resistor X of unknown resistance. A galvanometer is connected as shown in Fig. 6.2.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 165, 920, 199]]<|/det|>
A nucleus X has 14 nucleons and \(p\) protons. The ratio of charge to mass for nucleus X is \(4.1 \times 10^{7} \text{C kg}^{-1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 415, 606, 433]]<|/det|>
Nucleus X undergoes \(\beta^{- }\) decay to form nucleus Z.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 445, 586, 464]]<|/det|>
Complete the equation representing this decay.

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[235, 481, 767, 533]]<|/det|>
\[\underbrace{14}_{\dots \dots \dots \dots} \underbrace{ \begin{array}{c}{\dots \dots \dots \dots}\\ {\dots \dots \dots \dots} \end{array} } \underbrace{ \begin{array}{c}{\dots \dots \dots \dots}\\ {\dots \dots \dots \dots} \end{ array} } \underbrace{ \begin{array}{c}{\dots \dots \dots \dots}\\ {\dots \dots \dots \dots} \\ \end{array} } \underbrace{ \begin{array}{c}{\dots \dots \dots \dots}\\ {\dots \dots \dots \dots} \end{array} }\]
